title: Legislative Memo: Strengthening New York’s Anti-SLAPP Statute

last_post.content:
FOX's claim:

Dominion filed a lawsuit claiming $1.6 billion in damages as an attention-grabbing publicity stunt. Fox is protect by New York’s anti-SLAPP law, which is intended to protect news sources from harassment lawsuits or lawsuits filed for publicity.

FOX also challenges the $1.6 billion in damages saying that discovery showed Dominion is doing well and even gave bonuses to employees and was never worth anything like 1.6 billion

About anti-SLAPP: https://www.nyclu.org/en/legislation/legislative-memo-strengthening-new-yorks-anti-slapp-statute

7/

Over on the birdsite, some people have been discovering geometric packing problems, about how small of a bounding shape you can draw around some number of a smaller shape.

(Sometimes the solutions are really beautiful, you see. And sometimes, um. See attached.)

I'd been unable to find this page I remembered about these. Turns out the professor who maintained it retired, so the old links to it broke. But it does still exist! So you too can experience the rollercoaster of https://erich-friedman.github.io/packing/index.html

hack away!

title: Inside the Heart of ChatGPT’s Darkness

last_post.content:
The second to last paragraph in this @garymarcus post makes it clear how the LLM hydra has many heads:

"So, to sum up, we now have the world’s most used chatbot, governed by training data that nobody knows about, obeying an algorithm that is only hinted at, glorified by the media, and yet with ethical guardrails that only sorta kinda work and that are driven more by text similarity than any true moral calculus. And there is little if any government regulation in place…"

https://garymarcus.substack.com/p/inside-the-heart-of-chatgpts-darkness

title: Aegis Authenticator - Secure 2FA app for Android

last_post.content:
Now that there are discussions about 2FA using app-based instead of using SMS, I want to mention that Google Authenticator isn't the only app to do it and they're really not synonymous with TOTP 2FA no matter how hard they're trying to make people believe that.

For any site that says you have to use Google Authenticator or Microsoft Authenticator, you can actually just use any 2FA app, that will work the exact same, sometimes with more features, and with just as much security, because the algorithm is not some kind of proprietary thing, it's an open standard.

I personally use Aegis on Android because it's the one that seems the least bullshit-y to me: https://getaegis.app/

It's been serving me well and I recommend it.

title: Do Republicans want to cut Social Security and Medicare?

last_post.content:
A five year sunset on all legislation (even if a few programs are exempted and who believes them) is a foolish and irresponsible idea. It means uncertainty about whether any legislation or policy would continue—this will produce economic chaos. It also requires Congress to reconsider the entire federal government every five years. That's a project which Congress is unlikely to be able to complete in time—and that will lead to political chaos. Of course Republicans want that.

This is a proposal for undermining our democracy. That kind of nihilism seems to be the only goal of the Republican Party today. If the GOP gets its way, it’s a permanent serfdom.

They desperately want to gut the safety net, worker wages, and consumer protections so they can feed the rich more gold. Radical, to say the least.

The radical proposal to let Medicare and Social Security lapse, explained-
https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2023/2/16/23598343/social-security-medicare-sunset-joe-biden-rick-scott

title: Tesla Workers Announced a Union Drive. The Next Day They Were Fired.

last_post.content:
"Tesla Workers Announced a Union Drive. The Next Day They Were Fired."

This happens all the time because under US labor law the maximum penalty if the workers win an illegal dismissal case is back pay--get this--*minus* any earnings from any other job they took in the interim to pay their bills. Needless to say , the legal proceedings can take many months and into a year or longer. US labor law is broken.

https://inthesetimes.com/article/tesla-workers-union-labor-buffalo-new-york-firings-nlrb-elon-musk

All of the recommended accounts have posted before!

If you click on an account and it looks blank to you, it may be because their previous posts haven't federated to your server yet.

However, after you follow them all of their posts from that moment onwards will federate to your server and you will see them.

This can happen if their account is very new or your server is very new. As you and they spend more time on here, this situation will become rarer.

More info at https://fedi.tips/why-does-someones-account-page-look-completely-blank-is-it-really-blank

title: After AI chatbot goes a bit loopy, Microsoft tightens its leash

last_post.content:
Microsoft says no more talking with the Bing AI about its feelings. (It doesn't have any.) No more leading questions about sentience. (It's pattern-matching internet text.) And no more rambling chats. (It's just copying your tone, anyway.)

Now, after five question-answers, it says it would "prefer not to continue this conversation."

https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/02/18/microsoft-bing-chatbot/
